data.name: The messenger of the lake
data.subtitle: Welcome to the Environment Museum of Stymphalia, of the Piraeus Bank GroupÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Cultural Foundation.
data.description: During the mission there will be questions. You can answer each one of them with the help of texts, objects or spaces in the Museum. You will be asked to pass through trials (such as answering multiple-choice questions, typing "key words", taking pictures etc.).You may start! Good luck on your mission!

trials.name: Stymphalia! Our grandparents' village!
trials.description: Stymphalia! Our grandparents' village! The same longing each time you come back here! To see the lake! To hear the sound of the waves among the reeds! To listen to birds, frogs, insects!

trials.name: Yet, suddenly, you hear a different sound!
trials.description: Yet, suddenly, you hear a different sound! You spot a figure moving behind the reeds. It's a man dressed in a white tunic fastened with a clasp on his right shoulder. He's holding a reed as a rod.

trials.name: You still cannot believe this is happening
trials.description: You still cannot believe this is happening… And yet, reality becomes enmeshed with mythology, in a sequence of surprises. You are facing Stymphalos, the mythical king of the area, son of Elatos and Laodice!  You ask him if he needs help ... "Not me" he answers... "the lake! Man's relationships with nature has been disrupted. A relationship that kept the lake of Stymphalia and the area around it almost unchanged for centuries…. The balance has been disrupted.  You will be my messenger, the emissary of the lake! And you will take our message throughout the whole world...There is large building on the shore of the lake, they call it "Museum". It has a wealth of information about the lake and its history, its environment, the people who lived here and their activities. Go and find out as much as you can...

trials.name: And suddenly, this man disappeared through
trials.description: And suddenly, this man disappeared through the dense thickets of reeds exactly as he had appeared ... Its' true! You met King Stymphalos... And he gave you an important mission, just as King Eurystheus to Hercules! Follow the instructions and begin your own adventure!

trials.name: First you must learn about the land and the waters of Stymphalia.
trials.description: First you must learn about the land and the waters of Stymphalia.\Go to the starting point of the exhibition and find the model that presents the erosion process of the rocks in the area, leading to the formation of the lake. Pass in front of the   limestone to start the rain! Water flows slowly and erodes steadily the rocks, passes through them and ends up in the lower levels where it creates the lake. Take a picture of the model with your cell phone so that you remember water's central role in the shaping of the landscape.

quiz.question: What is "Karst erosion"?
answer: The erosion of limestone by rainwater
Chemistry term describing the process of interaction between two liquids

quiz.question: What is "Karst erosion"?
answer: The erosion of limestone by rainwater
Chemistry term describing the process of interaction between two liquids

trials.name: Right!
trials.description: Right! But don't go before seeing the display case opposite, with the most representative rocks of the area.

trials.name: Tripoli Zone
trials.description: Approach the most recent rock from the "Tripoli Zone". Can you discern the origin of the fossils you see? Choose the right answer:

quiz.question: Approach the most recent rock from the "Tripoli Zone". Can you discern the origin of the fossils you see? Choose the right answer:

aftercomplete.moreinfo: They are nummulites which, although fossilised animals, do exactly the same as plants in nature! They transform carbon to oxygen.

trials.name: Geological formations in the area of Stymphalia
trials.description: Now follow the course of the exhibition and find the model with the audiovisual application titled "Geological formations in the area of Stymphalia".

trials.name: Lake Stymphalia
trials.description: To move on, you have to answer the following question:Lake Stymphalia is:

quiz.question: To move on, you have to answer the following question, Lake Stymphalia is:

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Lake Stymphalia is the only natural lake in the mountain area of Corinthia.

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Lake Stymphalia is the only natural lake in the mountain area of Corinthia.

trials.name: Did you know that ever since Antiquity
trials.description: Did you know that ever since Antiquity there had been efforts to manage the waters of the lake with the construction of large engineering projects?

trials.name: Which Roman emperor ordered
trials.description: Which Roman emperor ordered the construction of the largest one in the area in order to ensure water supply for the fountains and the bathhouses of ancient Corinth?

quiz.question: Which Roman emperor ordered the construction of the largest one in the area in order to ensure water supply for the fountains and the bathhouses of ancient Corinth?

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Emperor Hadrian, a short while before his death, constructed Hadrian's Aqueduct to ensure water supply for the city of Corinth.

trials.name: Which Roman emperor ordered
trials.description: Which Roman emperor ordered the construction of the largest one in the area in order to ensure water supply for the fountains and the bathhouses of ancient Corinth?

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Emperor Hadrian, a short while before his death, constructed Hadrian's Aqueduct to ensure water supply for the city of Corinth.

trials.name: Hadrian's Aqueduct
trials.description: Now find the cross-section of Hadrian's Aqueduct and watch the digital film that presents reconstructions of some sections.

trials.name: The plants, the animals and the people in Lake Stymphalia.
trials.description: Now is the time for you to learn about the plants, the animals and the people in Lake Stymphalia.First you have to visit the model under the glass floor, presenting traces of mammals in the area.

trials.name: The small footprints
trials.description: Can you find which animal has left the small footprints on the right side of the model? They indicate quick pace by a small animal, which you can locate in the pictures on the left side wall in the exhibition unit:

quiz.question: Can you find which animal has left the small footprints on the right side of the model? They indicate quick pace by a small animal, which you can locate in the pictures on the left side wall in the exhibition unit:

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Continue your visit to the Museum following the course of the exhibition.

trials.description: Can you find which animal has left the small footprints on the right side of the model? They indicate quick pace by a small animal, which you can locate in the pictures on the left side wall in the exhibition unit:

aftercomplete.moreinfo: After all King Stymphalos made a good choice! But remember, you still have a lot to learn about the area of the lake, and there's so little time...Continue your visit to the Museum following the course of the exhibition.

trials.name: Fishing in the Lake
trials.description: See the real-size cross-section of the lake, climb carefully on a boat and make time to watch the short film title "Fishing in the Lake". After it's over, take a selfie with your cell phone to show that you are in the lake itself. At the aquarium you will find the two kinds of fish that live in the lake. Find them on the table title "The Habitat of the Lake", which you saw in the end of the first exhibition unit.

trials.name: What kinds of fish can be found in the aquarium?
trials.description: What kinds of fish can be found in the aquarium?

quiz.question: What kinds of fish can be found in the aquarium?

trials.name: What kinds of fish can be found in the aquarium?
trials.description: What kinds of fish can be found in the aquarium?

quiz.question: What kinds of fish can be found in the aquarium?

trials.name: Carp has been introduced to the lake
trials.description: Very good! Carp has been introduced to the lake in order to be fished. Stymphalian minnows are endemic and able to survive even in periods of drought because they sink into the mud and continue to live.

trials.name: Crowding the baliza
trials.description: Before you move on, find information about "Crowding the baliza" and give the right answer about it:

quiz.question: Before you move on, find information about "Crowding the baliza" and give the right answer about what it was:
answer: A form of hunting in the area

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Each November, usually, the coot (baliza), the most common bird of those wintering in Lake Stymphalia, was hunted by groups in boats.

trials.name: Crowding the baliza

trials.name: Is hunting in the lake allowed today?
trials.description: Is hunting in the lake allowed today?

quiz.question: Is hunting in the lake allowed today?
answer: Yes but only in the summer months

aftercomplete.moreinfo: The area has been designated as a a protected site under the Natura 2000 network, and all activities involving professional fishing and hunting in the lake have been banned. Lake Stymphalia has also been designated as a "Wildlife Centre".

trials.name: Agricultural Activities
trials.description: Now you are in the exhibition unit titled "Agricultural Activities". Everything is familiar because your grandfather is a farmer, and your childhood is filled with images of fields and cultivations. So you must find the next questions quite easy.

trials.name: Which products are cultivated traditionally in this area?
trials.description: Which products are cultivated traditionally in this area?

quiz.question: Which products are cultivated traditionally in this area?

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Other than grains and vines, the cultivation of outdoor tomatoes during the summer months has also been developing in the last few years.

trials.name: What is "winnowing"
trials.description: What is "winnowing"

quiz.question: Let's see now what else you know about grains. Find the main stages of grain. What is "winnowing"
answer: The separation of wheat from chaff
The way the boat moves in the water

trials.name: What is "winnowing"

trials.name: An unknown farmer solved a series of problems
trials.description: An unknown farmer solved a series of problems during the cultivation of grains with a clever patent that is exhibited in the Museum. He managed to hold more in his arms in order to decrease the number of times he had to cross the field so as to load the cut grain before forming the sheaves. At the same time, he protected his hands from snake bites, since snakes had been hunting for rodents on the grain field. Locate the wooden object that he invented and type its name in the field "Keyword entry".

trials.name: Locate the wooden object
trials.description: Locate the wooden object that he invented and type its name:

trials.description: It's the wooden glove!

trials.name: The end of your visit is near
trials.description: The end of your visit is near, and the knowledge you have accumulated will make King Stymphalos proud! Yet, you have to explore another exhibition unit: "Livestock Farming and Apiculture". Observe the exhibits carefully. Livestock farming has a special role in the lives of the inhabitants in the Stymphalia area, since it is their main occupation, whether exclusive or complementary to agriculture.

trials.name: Do you know why the shepherd puts bells on the sheep and goats?
trials.description: Do you know why the shepherd puts bells on the sheep and goats?

quiz.question: Do you know why the shepherd puts bells on the sheep and goats?
answer: To locate them and recognise them
Because it's the new trend in fashion

aftercomplete.moreinfo: The different sounds from the bells help the experienced shepherd to easily identify and quickly locate his flock.

trials.description: Do you see a shepherd's cape somewhere? Approach and observe. Can you tell its material?

quiz.question: Do you see a shepherd's cape somewhere? Approach and observe. Can you tell its material?

trials.name: Goat's hair may not be so soft
trials.description: Goat's hair may not be so soft as sheep's but it's 100% waterproof and keeps body temperature steady.  The shepherd or shepherdess (the cape that is exhibited is for females) wears the cape throughout the year

trials.name: Just before the last one
trials.description: Just before the last one, there is the sub-unit of apiculture. Very popular throughout the Mediterranean and elsewhere! Observe the old-type conical beehives made of woven canes. They are an excellent sample of the art of basket weaving. The beekeeper used to smear the outside of the hive in order to insulate it and protect his bees.

trials.name: Do you know what material he used?
trials.description: Do you know what material he used?

quiz.question: Do you know what material he used?

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Mud functioned as an insulator, while the smell of dung kept away the animals who hungered for delicious honey.

trials.name: Do you know what material he used?
trials.description: Do you know what material he used?

quiz.question: Do you know what material he used?

aftercomplete.moreinfo: Mud functioned as an insulator, while the smell of dung kept away the animals who hungered for delicious honey.

trials.name: Transport by Pack Animals
trials.description: Now you have reached the exhibition unit titled "Transport by Pack Animals" and the last question of your mission. There are two different kinds of iron horseshoes for pack animals (horses, donkeys, mules)

trials.name: Can you say why?
trials.description: Now you have reached the exhibition unit titled "Transport by Pack Animals" and the last question of your mission. There are two different kinds of iron horseshoes for pack animals (horses, donkeys, mules). Can you say why?

quiz.question: Now you have reached the exhibition unit titled "Transport by Pack Animals" and the last question of your mission. There are two different kinds of iron horseshoes for pack animals (horses, donkeys, mules). Can you say why?
answer: Because they were used in the mountains and the plains according to the terrain
Because cats wore them as well

trials.name: You can officially have the title
trials.description: You were patient, and through your visit to the Museum, your knowledge about the natural environment of Stymphalia and the primary activities of the inhabitants through the exhibits in the Museum is now complete. You can officially have the title of the "emissary" of Lake Stymphalia!

trials.name: King Stymphalos for Lake Stympahlia
trials.description: Now you can understand the concern of King Stymphalos for Lake Stympahlia and the message that you have to spread: humans and nature are directly connected, they influence each other and determine each other's fate in an intense and dynamic relationship. This is why people should always act with respect and prudence within the framework that is defined by the natural environment itself.This is your legacy from today's visit and these are the riches of the Environment Museum of Stymphalia. And don't forget your duty, to carry the message of these riches wherever you go!

trials.name: Congratulations!
trials.description: Congratulations! \\You have completed the game of the Environment Museum of Stymphalia!\\Script: Piraeus Bank Group Cultural Foundation\\Photographs: Piraeus Bank Group Cultural Foundation, N. Daniilidis, T. Kottas, L. Kiourktsoglou

completed.info: You completed the current event. We will be waiting for you to play more games.
